overview: The purpose of this Act is to appropriate funds for the continued implementation of the kauhale initiative. [1] This bill also creates the supportive housing special fund to assist the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects for special needs individuals or families. [1] It also creates a kauhale initiative special fund to assist the statewide office of homelessness and housing solutions to implement the kauhale initiative. [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $50,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative. [1] The bill appropriates $12,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027 from general revenues to be deposited into the supportive housing special fund. [1] [1] Out of the supportive housing special fund, the bill appropriates $12,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027 for supportive housing projects, services, and $189,750 (HB431_.HTM.txt) for one temporary full-time equivalent housing finance specialist I position. [1] [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The fiscal projections are based on specific appropriations detailed in the bill for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. [1] [1] The bill follows previous legislative efforts to fund homelessness programs, such as the ohana zones pilot program which initially appropriated $30,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) and was later provided an additional $15,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt). [1] [1] In 2023, the legislature also set aside $5,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) to fund a supportive housing pilot program and $25,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) to fund the kauhale initiative. [1] [1]
agency_impact: The Hawaii housing finance and development corporation will administer the supportive housing special fund and establish one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) housing finance specialist I position. [1] [1] The statewide office on homelessness and housing solutions will administer the kauhale initiative special fund. [1] The office of the governor will expend the appropriations for the kauhale initiative and may transfer funds to designated executive branch departments or agencies. [1] [1]
economic_impact: The measure is intended to address Hawaii's high homelessness rate by funding responses for homeless individuals and families and those at risk of homelessness. [1] [1] It provides funding for the development, operation, and maintenance of affordable, supportive housing projects and the provision of supportive services for households with special needs. [1] [1] The bill aims to help special needs populations live more stable and productive lives. [1]
policy_impact: This Act establishes a supportive housing special fund to be administered by the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation. [1] It also establishes a kauhale initiative special fund to be administered by the statewide office on homelessness and housing solutions. [1] [1] The measure establishes one temporary full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) housing finance specialist I within the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation. [1]
revenue_sources: The bill appropriates funds out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [1] [1] The supportive housing special fund may also include sums from private contributions, proceeds from repayment of loans, interest, fees, other returns, and moneys from other sources. [1] [1] Similarly, the kauhale initiative special fund may include sums appropriated by the legislature, program revenues, private contributions, interest, and moneys from other sources. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The bill appropriates funds for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027. [1] [1] For the kauhale initiative, the bill appropriates $50,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and the same sum for FY 2026-2027. [1] These funds are for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative including expenses related to the development and operation of kauhale, provision of project-based rent supplement payments, provision of support services, and staffing costs. [1] These sums shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal biennium. [1] For the supportive housing special fund, the bill appropriates $12,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) from general revenues to be deposited into the fund in FY 2025-2026 and the same amount in FY 2026-2027. [1] [1] From this fund, $12,000,000 (HB431_.HTM.txt) is appropriated for FY 2025-2026 and the same for FY 2026-2027. [1] [1] This amount is for financing supportive housing projects and providing supportive services. [1] [1] A portion of this, $189,750 (HB431_.HTM.txt), is for one temporary 1.0 FTE housing finance specialist I. [1] There are no specified appropriations beyond FY 2026-2027, but the establishment of special funds implies a long-term initiative. [1] [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The Hawaii housing finance and development corporation may establish, revise, charge, and collect a reasonable service fee in connection with its financing, services, and approvals under the supportive housing program. [1] The fees collected shall be deposited into the supportive housing special fund. [1] The kauhale initiative special fund may also include program revenues as a source of funds. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: Moneys in the supportive housing special fund may be used to make loans to finance the development, pre-development, construction, acquisition, preservation, or substantial rehabilitation of supportive housing projects. [1] The appropriation for the kauhale initiative includes expenses related to the development and operation of kauhale. [1] This is consistent with past uses of similar funds for the construction of modular temporary units and renovation of existing structures. [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: The bill establishes a supportive housing special fund and a kauhale initiative special fund, indicating an ongoing need for funding beyond the initial two-year appropriation period. [1] [1] Continued operation of these initiatives and administration of the special funds will likely require future legislative appropriations. [1] [1] An amount from the supportive housing special fund may be used for ongoing administrative expenses incurred by the corporation in administering the fund. [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: No previous fiscal note was provided in the context.
